stimulusHtml: Which of the following correctly compares the strength of the two carbon-to-carbon bonds in the molecule represented in the Lewis diagram shown above?
choicesHtml: The carbon-to-carbon bond on the left is stronger because it is a double bond.
The carbon-to-carbon bonds are the same strength because the C-C-C bond angle is 180Â°.
The carbon-to-carbon bonds are the same strength because they are both bonds between carbon atoms.
The carbon-to-carbon bond on the right is stronger because there are more hydrogen atoms attached to the rightmost carbon atom than to the leftmost carbon atom.
